cab.content: Military Secret. 1360From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,nth April mo.(Received 16th.)4708. Malleson telegraphed, 10th April and 11th April, that some of the troops south of,Merv had been withdrawn to Merv and others to Askabad, partly owing to supply difficulties and partly to Frunze having recently satislied himself that there was no immediate danger of Afghan attack.2. Garrison of Merv, on 31st March, was 700 cavalry, 3,000 to 4,000 infantry, 18 guns, 50 to 60 machine guns, and 2 airplanes.3. On 16th March 400 men left Kerki for Kilif, but preparations for more troops are being made at Kerki.
